Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
A couple of trends are evident in the category of long-zoom cameras. First, companies are outfitting impossibly small cameras--pocket megazooms--with lenses that provide optical zoom ranges of 10X and up. Second, companies are going even bigger with larger-sized fixed-lens cameras, equipping them with optical-zoom lenses that approach 40X.
The Sony Cyber-shot HX100V is among the latter--a long-zoom camera with a larger body that resembles a small DSLR. Its 30X-optical-zoom lens is a few steps behind the 36X-optical-zoom Nikon Coolpix P500 and the 35X-optical-zoom Canon PowerShot SX30 IS in zoom range, but the HX100V offers other benefits that may ultimately make it more appealing than its rivals.
Like competing superzoom cameras, the HX100V offers a combination of manual, sem ... i-manual, and automatic exposure controls. The camera distinguishes itself from the pack with a few extras: built-in GPS, 3D snapshot and panorama features, excellent video quality, and a blazingly fast 10 frames-per-second continuous shooting speed. A full user guide is also built into the camera for quick reference, and there’s even a search option for it.
Hardware and Design
The 16-megapixel Sony Cyber-shot HX100V offers a backside-illuminated Exmor R CMOS sensor that the company says is designed for low-light operation. The HX100V’s optically stabilised 30X zoom lens reaches as far as the Nikon Coolpix P500’s 810mm on the telephoto end, but not as far as the 840mm Canon PowerShot SX30 IS. At 27mm wide-angle, the HX100V achieves a slightly narrower maximum than the P500’s mega-wide-angle 22.5mm and the SX30 IS's 24mm.
It isn't the widest of superzoom cameras, but the HX100V’s 27mm wide-angle lens does a good job of capturing landscapes and group shots. The lens is relatively fast, with a maximum aperture of F2.8 at wide angle, though it slows to F5.6 at telephoto.
It takes a lot to stabilise a 30X lens with a reach of 810mm; and though the camera’s Optical SteadyShot system is effective at wide-range-to-midrange focal lengths, you'll benefit from using a tripod or monopod when shooting at full telephoto. A tripod becomes all the more important when there’s not enough light to permit use of a super-fast shutter speed. The rule of thumb is that the minimum shutter speed should equal 1/focal length; in this case, that would be at least 1/810th of a second. At 810mm, however, holding the camera steady enough to keep the subject in the frame isn't easy.
Manual focus is available at the flip of a switch on the lens barrel and through use of the lens focus/zoom ring. Once you press the focus button atop the grip, the camera enlarges the image up to 7X, so you can fine-tune the focus more easily. Frankly, autofocus seems to work better (and faster), but tweaking the focus manually in macro mode is a helpful touch. By using the same ring, you can manually operate the zoom in conjunction with autofocus.
With its lens retracted, the HX100V measures 4.6 inches wide, 3.5 inches tall, and 3.6 inches deep, making it a bit smaller than either the Nikon Coolpix P500 or the Canon PowerShot SX30 IS. With its lens fully extended, the camera's optics don’t protrude much, so the unit is relatively compact for its class; it’s by no means pocketable, however.
At 1 pound, 4 ounces, the camera has enough heft to counterbalance the lens. The grip is raised and grooved, with enough room between it and the lens barrel to provide a solid handhold--particularly for people with large hands. Photographers with small hands may find the grip a little too deep, but it’s nicely contoured for comfort.
Like other superzooms, the HX100V is equipped with both an adjustable LCD and an eye-level EVF (electronic viewfinder). The 3-inch, high-resolution, 921,000-pixel LCD provides a clear view for composing and playback, with a five-step brightness control, and it worked well in our testing under most lighting conditions. The monitor is hinged at the bottom, so you can flip it out and tilt it for overhead and low-angle shots. The EVF is clear, albeit... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: BEST Bridge Camera On The Market!
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything! Image/Video Quality, 30xMegazoom lens
Cons: Nothing! If anything, the battery life could be tad longer.
After reading online reviews and testing several digital bridge cameras from Nikon, Canon, Panasonic and Fuji, I chose this Sony. It is a new product from Sony along with their travel compact HX9. Instead of going into details about ALL of the advanced features/sensors it has, I will just say I am more than pleased and IMPRESSED with its image quality!! It takes full 1080p HD stereo video and is CRYSTAL CLEAR. I also have a class 10 Sandisk Extreme Memory Card and the cameras operation is FAST. It shoots in 3D and Panorama. It has excellent build quality and the size is just right in my opinion. It is very smooth and quiet..even at 120x digital zoom the im ... age stabilization keeps the shot focused and steady...this camera is incredible bottom line! If you shoot RAW or would like an additional flash, this camera does not offer a hot shoe or a raw shooting mode but those are the only 2 cons I would say it has. Overall for what you get for the price, great job Sony! You got a new fan here for sure! Get it, you won't be disappointed!!
***Also, the LCSU10 Bag they recommend for it is too small!*** You have to squeeze the camera into that bag. I bought the LCSU20 bag and it is a perfect fit! It also has removable velcro partitions and extra storage compartments.You can get your charger/USB, extra battery, mini tripod in it as well. I mentioned extra battery because after a day of use on vacation the battery was completely discharged. But thats to be expected with any camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this to replace my DSC H9. I've only had this camera a couple weeks and haven't taken many pics with it, but the few I have taken have turned out rather nicely. The screen is a good size, but I still wish I could turn it all the way around. Haven't tried any video with it yet, but will later this month. Although the camera is virtually the same size as my older Canon EOS Rebel XT (with no lens attached), the Sony with its 30X optical zoom is way more useful as a carry around camera for general picture taking. I may update this review after I have some more experience with it. So far, it's easy to use and I figured out how to use the manual settings without having to look at the book. Took the attached photo on manual, ISO 200, 1/200 at f 5.6, 30X optical zoom, h ... and held, spot auto focus. Sharply defined craters and crater rims. Perhaps not as sharp as my Sony Alpha 100 with the Perkin Elmer lens on the tripod, but definitely acceptable. Not nearly so expensive a camera as even the PE lens used on the Alpha. The main drawback to this camera is it offers only 4:3 and 16:9 formats-- no 3:2. The 16:9 is fine for panoramic views and wide screen video, but 4:3 is a terrible format for stills. Nobody, not even Sony builds a 4:3 monitor, lap top screen, or TV in these proportions any more. It doesn't even match the 4x6 photos you get from print services. This would be a 5 star camera if it had the 3:2 format capability. Sony, what were you thinking when you eliminated the 3:2 format? Can we get a firmware update that will rectify this situation? expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Carl Zeiss zoom lens
Cons: Control functions are not very intuitive.
The features of Sony's HX-100V "superzoom" camera add up to a great lightweight travel camera. So long as you do not expect to make prints larger than 11x17, the picture quality is more than adequate. It's built-in GPS feature uses a lot of battery power, so if you are taking lots of pictures and videos in your travels, you may want to carry a spare battery. Although the camera's lens is not threaded for filters or a lens hood, an adapter can be ordered from an independent supplier on the internet. This camera is an excellent vallue.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: EXCELLENT, EASY to use even for novice
Item.Review:
Pros: All the features; easy to use; quality of pictures; low light; viewfinder
Cons: Swivel screen turning in when not in use
I have a Canon EOS 60D as my primary camera, Canon SX 230 to throw in my pocket and recently purchased the Canon SX40 for times when I don't want to haul the 60D. I am very disappointed with the Canon SX40 for many reasons so I read the customer reviews for this Sony HX100V and went right out and purchased the camera. This was NO disappointment and the camera surpassed my expectations. The picture quality is up there with my Canon 60D. The features are outstanding! The soft skin, blur background (background defocus) and panorama are just a few that are fun even for a beginner photographer. The Scene Selection alone under SCN settings were selling feat ... ures for me. I took numerous photos of my pets in low lighting using Backlight Correction HDR and was amazed! I captured some excellent and professional style photos using this camera. The camera is easy to use without looking through a manual, easy to set up and fun to play with. It has a solid feel to it unlike the Canon SX40 which is light in the hand & the flash on the Canon is manual- you have to pop it up!!! I LOVE this SONY HX100V and highly recommend it!!! I love having a viewfinder option which is a must especially for sunny days and love the moving screen for hard to take pics. My only complaint is I wish the swivel screen could be turned in to protect it when it's not being used. The shutter speed is not like the Canon 60D of course but not bad. Great zoom and excellent video quality. The panorama feature works horizontal and vertical a feature I have never seen. Sony does an outstanding job on their panorama, it's easy to use and the pictures are stitched for you and come out fantastic. Kudos to Sony for this. I especially loved the Self Timer Portrait features..there is a 10 sec & 2 sec timer AND self-portrait for one person once the face is detected (2 sec) and one for two persons (shoots 2 seconds after 2 faces are detected). We do a lot of timer shots with friends so this is a fun and nice feature. The c ... expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Best camera purchase I've made so far
Item.Review:
Pros: easy to learn, focus options, not heavy, not loud
Cons: lack of paper manual, flash placement, neck strap too thin and hard to put on
I purchased this camera in July for primarily taking pictures of my family, pets and flowerbeds/nature. I was looking at Nikon and Canon cameras until an associate (who is experienced in photography) convinced me to reconsider this Sony cyber-shot. I went home and researched and my decision to purchase Sony was a great decision. I am still learning so I've not experienced all the camera has to offer. I am a beginner and this is my first digital "high end" camera. I've not sat at a computer for the online instructions to further my knowledge of this product- that's my laziness.
What I have learned/liked so far is the zoom. I can get ... up close and personal and the details are great. However some pics I've taken up close were a little blurred. Keep in mind this is probably my lack of experience in photography. Pictures printed are crisp and brightly colored. Loading them to my computer was easy too. I love that this is auto or manual zoom. And when you look into the viewfinder, the LCD screen automatically detects and when you move away from the viewfinder, the screen resumes play. The buttons are simple and easy to manuever. You have options of what the screen will display. For me the battery lasts awhile. If it's used ALL day long, I'm sure it would have to be charged once or twice.
Ok the cons so far- The flash will pop up if it's not set for no flash and my fingers are always in the way forcing me to redo the picutre. I do not like the placement of the flash-I have to learn to reposition my hands. I could not figure how to hook the neck strap to the camera or the cord for the lens cover. The lens cover will pop off if it's forgotten to be removed before turning on. I feel like I scratch that part of the camera but guess I don't. I do wish there were a screen protector for the lens. I have found one for the LCD screen though.
All in all I am very pleased with this purchase and plan to learn the ins and outs to better my skills and get the most this camera has to o ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I'm former professional photographer who now just shoots for fun - family and vacations. I have a Nikon DSLR and several lenses and a Lumix 3x point-and-shoot, but in planning a long vacation to Hawaii, I wanted a camera that gave me good zoom range with one lens. I compared all the available super-zooms and found the Sony DSC-HX100V gave me what I was looking for. Reviews of the other brands of super-zooms found them lacking in picture quality, especially at higher ISO's. The Carl Zeiss outfitted Sony was rated very well in that aspect. My results so far have been very gratifying. The jpeg's I've shot show good resolution and detail, comparing well with the Nikon DSLR. The HD video feature worked very well. I video'ed a friend's jazz band at a little club and was pleased with th ... e results of that as well. As a former all-manual kinda guy, I appreciate having manual settings available. But for the wife, full-auto will be the way to go. One or two quibbles: when switching shooting modes, the onscreen display stays on much too long. Between-shot times are long because you have to wait for the diplay of the previous shot to go off. But I think that issue can be addressed in the menu. Since I am not producing photos for publication, the Sony more that fits the bill for my need for decent picture quality and a long zoom. As it is new, the price is higher than comparable cameras, but I think it is worth the price. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: My main use for this camera is surveillance. Video takes approximately 1.5 seconds to start, but the Image Stabilization is fantastic. Even the digital zoom is sufficient for courtroom use at 100X! The ability to choose video format, mp4, is nice. The ability to grab still frames from video while still in camera, is a time saver and nice feature. Also, low light performance is good for video and still. Menu is easy, and the custom button on top is a sweet feature. (Does not shoot raw, but auto white balance is pretty good.) Nice 3d feel when photos are taken with appropriate care. I also shoot with an Alpha900, Zeiss Ikon, Contax and c/y glass, and Rodenstock lenses. This camera is a gem for the money.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Features, full 1080p video, burst mode, 30x zoom, Zeiss lens
Cons: 3D features, flash, no hot shoe for additional flash
I priced a lot of bridge cameras before settling on the Sony. The features and image quality alone made it the best of the bunch for me. The features are honestly too numerous to mention but one I've really gotten to like is the burst mode feature. I've missed fewer "Kodak moments" using this feature. Process time is remarkably fast considering you can shoot up to 10 frames per second. The video is outstanding! It's shoots higher quality video than my video camera. Most megazoom cameras I tried were impossibly shaky at full zoom. This camera handles that better than the others I've tested. I still recommend a tripod if you're going to do a lot of full ... zoom shooting. I like the adjustable LCD display. It's very clear and bright. Battery life is also very good. The picture quality is not in the DSLR range but it is as good or better than the point and shoot cameras I have owned or tried out.
The camera is not hard to use but it will take some time to learn all the features. I still haven't after 2 months.
My only issues with the camera are the gimmicky 3D features and the barely adequate flash with no hot shoe to add a better flash.
Overall, an excellent camera. Great for someone looking for more than a simple point & shoot but not quite ready to jump to DSLR. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: SONY MAKES A REAL GOOD CAMERA
Item.Review:
Pros: Good for all events/activites
Cons: Can't turn the screen around, like a cannon, to keep it from getting scratched.
I was/am a loyal cannon guy. I love Cannon Point and shoots; I have had many cannon's and loved my SX-20is, until my wife left it on the truck of her car.... I was considering stepping into the SX-30is, then read it was the same image sensor, etc and some other things were the same as the 20, so I looked elsewhere.
I have been blown away by the quality of photos and Video this camera takes. The camera has great settings. The AUTO mode is idiot proof, the AUTO+ Mode takes great photos as well, but the SCN mode with all of its different settings combined with a TRIPOD will take photos that compare to an SLR. The images with soft focus or background ou ... t of focus look awesome and super professional. Note that the 10 Shot burst feature is AWESOME! When you have kids, you can take 40-50 shots with in a min, and you are sure to have a few where they are both looking at the camera.
I have taken a lot of video with this camera. It is truly 1080P. People that knock AVCHD file type need to get with the program. It is the best in HD video file types. Note, in 1080p, settings the files are EXREMELY large to preserve the HD quality. My suggestion to folks it to make sure you have a large external drive. The AVCHD files play file in windows media player and other players. The SONY file manager/picture software is OK, and it does also play the files nice. **NOTE: Google Picasa doesn't recognize AVCHD**. There are great software programs like XILISOFT HD Video File Converter that you can use to convert these AVCHD files into anything. I like to convert them into MP4, and then put on My Android Phone to show others.
Sony has become a real player in the market. This is a do/all camera that will surely not disappoint. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Three Items Were Deal Breakers for Me
Item.Review: I'll cover the CONS first, since there were only three of them - but they WERE deal breakers for me.First, the camera is not set up for taking HDR (High Dynamic Range) pictures. When using Automatic Exposure Bracketing, (AEB), this DSC-HX100V camera only allows you to set plus or minus one f-stop. When taking HDR pictures, setting a minimum of two f-stops either side of the on exposure picture - is absolutely mandatory for BASIC HDR picture taking. In other words, with the MAXIMUM bracketing possible , the DSC-HX100V takes the first picture on exposure, the second is taken one f-stop below, and the third and final picture is taken one f-stop above. It is not possible to set anything greater than one f-stop variation. Almost all of the other cameras in this class allows you to set ... up-to two f-stops below and two f-stops above the on exposure picture using (AEB). (It is possible to set the exposure manually, but this is at least ten times more complex and extends the image acquisition time by a factor of 25.)For me this was the first dealbreaker.Secondly, Sony uses a proprietary format for its HD video. I was not able to find a simple free player which handled that particular format easily. GOM failed. It played the video haltingly, and could not find an appropriate codec. VLC failed as well . The Sony Movie File Format: AVCHD 60i / 60p requires that you install the special Sony player-software (that comes on the CD with the camera) on your computer, and THEN you need to register your device. This is the absolute ANTITHESIS of what you WANT to do when you take video of the family, or the kids, and then want to immediately share it with other members of your family, who may be scattered around the country. Or for that matter upload it to YouTube etc. For me this was a second dealbreaker.The third CON was having to charge the battery in the camera. This of course means that you cannot take pictures and charge the battery at the same time. You either do one, or the other. And if you have a spare battery, you cannot charge that while you're taking pictures.I don't know how much money Sony saved by not providing a separate charger is proprietary battery, but in my opinion, it wasn't worth it. If you're doing any serious shooting with the camera, you're going to buy extra batteries, and you ARE going to HAVE TO buy at least one extra battery charger. While this was not an absolute dealbreaker for me, it represented a guaranteed add-on expense which I balked for the positives, I think the camera is superior to its competition in almost every other way. The pictures were clean, clear, crisp. The zoom worked exactly as advertised. The screen on the back of the camera is nothing short of superlative. The controls for me are extremely well-placed. The video review was incredibly easy to use. And with the exception of the three items mentioned above, the camera was an absolute delight to use and take pictures with.IF the three CONS mentioned above are NOT a problem for you, then I would HIGHLY recommend this camera in the mega-zoom expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: The panorama is amazing and close-up shots look very good.
Cons: It does not come with a battery charger, HDMI adaptor, or USB/AV cable.
I purchased this camera on May 24, 2011 from BestBuy. I have been waiting for it since April at Sony website. I take a lot of pictures for different events. I have used the camera everyday since I purchased it. I have not had a chance to explore all that the camera can do.
I took picture today at a Lupus Walk. I did not change the settings to take action pictures but most of them came out fine. I took a video of part of a graduation and the sound and display are amazing. I have not attached it to my television.
I love, love the panorama feature. You do not have to wait for it to stitch. I downloaded the manual from Sony b ... efore I purchased the camera so that I could learn as much as I could before I purchased it.
There are not a lot of useful youtube videos of the camera. It does not come with all the accessories that the DSC-HX1 comes with. You have to purchase the battery charger, HDMI adaptor, and USB/AV cable separately.
I would not recommend this camera to a beginner. I feel a person who know a little bit more about taking pictures before buying this camera. It is amazing and I am enjoying it. It takes really great close-up shots. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Very good camera, with loads of features
Item.Review: This camera is probably one of the best "bridge" cameras out there. Has many features, but also has some it should not have, and also lacks some it should have. Some of the good ones are big zoom, lots of mega-pixels, a GPS and compass built in, a burst shot mode, a panoramic mode, as well as the standard scene modes. In addition, you can adjust all the settings such as ISO, aperture, and shutter speed manually. What it did not need was the 3-D capability for movies and photos, as you can only play it back on a 3-D TV. I'd hate to buy one just for that reason. One of the other major drawbacks is the manual could be better, and the built in manual definitely needs to be better. You cannot screw a lens filter on the Carl Zeiss lens. I wish there was a way to take time lapse pictures and movi ... es. I would have liked a remote with it. It comes with a cable to recharge the camera and it acts as a power cord. There is a cable to connect to a computer, however, you have to buy an HDMI cable if you want to hook it to the TV. Would I buy it again - Yes. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I was planning to buy similar Fuji product (FinePix HS20EXR) for our Coast to Coast USA trip, as I had Fuji camera before but after short hands-on session in B&H shop I decided to select this model although I had no clue about it or its users' ranking beforehand. During my trip I was nicely surprised by performance of this camera despite the fact that about 95% of the time I was using Superior Auto mode. Instead of listing good things I will put some comments on things that could be better: ??? Flash ON mode. It is not possible to switch flash ON manually by using flash selection button in Intelligent and Superior Auto modes. Instead, first you have to change shooting mode and then via flash mode button select flash ON which is not nice; ??? iSweep panorama mode. You can catch only 180 ... degree panorama. If you stop shooting at let's say 120 degree, the picture will anyway be 180 degree wide but last 60 degree part would be black, which makes picture horrible; ??? Colors. In the low light colours of the pictures are darker that they are in reality. Movie colors and picture colours (simultaneously taken in Superior Auto mode in low light during filming) differs ??? movie colors are much close to reality; ??? Movie. It takes some time after you press movie button and real capturing begins. Wind noise, even with such noise reduction feature ON is quite high. Software provided with the camera not allows you to manage audio tracks of the movies. ??? Zoom. If you would like to take Macro picture of relatively close small objects and in order to enlarge them using zoom, quite likely camera will not be able to focus the object; ??? Functional restrictions handling. In certain modes you can't make some functional selections and camera provide you appropriate warning messages on the screen (for example: not possible to select burst settings in Superior Auto mode; not possible to change flash settings if burst settings selected). The possibility to make necessary changes for that particular shot from the warning message menu screen would be excellent solution as now you have to exit warning message first, then do the changes in the mode or settings and only then continue with shooting; ??? GPS. Each time after power ON it takes some time to get GPS fix although you might be in the similar position and time between changed from OFF to ON is just few minutes (caused by power saving reasons, manual or auto for example). So if you would like to have coordinates of your picture, which is cool, you have to wait before you can start shooting. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: An Ultra Zoom Camera with an Ultra techn
Item.Review: Sony HX 100 V is an ultra zoom camera, with an ultra high technology. Its intelligent auto mood and intelligent auto + moods are superb shooting moods. Specially, if you are a nature and photographer, because your subject won't stay in a one spot, as you want it to be. So the intelligent auto + mood do the focusing and shooting moods faster than any other camera in the market, at this moment. With this camera in intelligent auto + mood in wild, you will never miss any opportunity of shooting. I have used many ultra zoom cameras, Nikon P 90, Olympus SP 800, Canon SX 30 is, Olympus SZ 30MR, and a Leica V Lux 2, and this Sony HX 100 is my latest one. It excels others in auto shooting mood, which is the main purpose of buying a point and shoot camera. But as I have seen with many Sony sensors ... in compared to other cameras, Sony photos are a bit more red colour than others. So, even though it is a great camera to take wild life photography, you will get bit reddish pictures. As in wild life photos, it should be more in to green colour, as many backgrounds will be in green. (Trees, bushes, and grass.) Then only the pictures would be nice to look at. As I believe, people who but an ultra zoom camera to shoot more long range, wild life pictures. If you are taking portraits, or seen, you could use a normal long range camera. If Sony won't to make the best Ultra Zoom Camera, they have to re design their sensors. It has so many superior options, like high resolution panorama, and fast shooting moods, which will cut above the rest. Very user friendly camera, which will make a professional out of any armature. So, the Sony HX 100 is a perfect camera, but not the best because of the red colour issue. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I have purchased almost all the newer sony products over the past 2-3 yrs, and while all the cameras have their virtues, the HX100V is the most versatile and fun. As someone told me once, The best camera is the one you will use the most. This camera is it. The larger DLSR's are just a bit too big for my type of photography- which is walking and clicking photos of the environment. The NEX is very easy to carry, but as stated before, the on screen menus are too clumsy to operate while on the move. The Alphas are great cameras, but with a larger lens, (I have the 18-250 zoom, still a bit heavy. My only hesitation with the HX100, (I have the HX1 as well) was the inability to add filters. But the 30X makes it all worthwhile. I find paying closer attention to the camera basics, (where th ... e sun is, etc) allow me to get great pics , have a light weight, great lens versitility, and awesome features. The panaromic mode is the best, and low light pictures come out very well. Also, the price at B&H really is a great value, (I paid almost as much for the extra lens for the Alpha). Overall, I am finding this is the camera I am going to for all occasions, because you just don't really have any limits. I am amazed at the clarity of the pics at the 800 mm range with just hand holding, I don't carry a tripod and don't find a need for one. The Sony dials give you just what you need, and allow you to focus on the fun. The batterys last a lot longer than on any of the other cameras. Highly recommended. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 2 out of 2 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Intuitive menus, priced right, easy to use out of the box.
Cons: Wish it had a reversing LCD like the Canon
I tried all of the current super zoom cameras. Only two would easily lock focus at full zoom...the Nikon and the Sony. While the Nikon was a little smaller and more ergonomic for my wife's small hands, the Nikon took very grainy video with bad color. The Sony takes great video and more importantly stills. Even at full zoom the picture quality is awesome. On viewing fully zoomed pictures, you could still zoom further in with incredible detail. My wife took a macro of the frost on a jet window and you could see almost every crystal clearly. Full zoom action shots are fully focused with the burst photo setting. Having owned several Canons I have always been predispos ... ed to buy a Canon. However, in this instance the Canon was not even in the running. This is nearly a perfect point and shoot with quality approaching a DSLR. If you want a great camera with a super zoom, buy this camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Surprisingly good image quality in Auto mode
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent trip camera, leave it on "Auto" or "Auto+" and shoot. Viewfinder useful in bright light conditions.
Cons: Need to buy travel charger (BC-TRV) to avoid carrying around clunky in-camera charging line cord. No pdf Manual.
We needed a camera for travel with a megazoom capability because one cannot always be in the ideal location to get a good shot. I was wary of the image quality from a x30 zoom, thinking that it would be too soft. This is sometimes the case in the corners of the shot, but I was pleasantly surprised at not only the center image sharpness, but also the ability of the camera to choose the best exposure conditions even under some very challenging conditions. This camera can give great handheld shots indoors with no flash, which is essential for museu ... ms and other natural light situations. The autofocus is fast and the vibration reduction is terrific. All these features add up to a sophisticated point and shoot megazoom camera that rarely misses a quickly composed shot.
I am a still photography purist, so I have not tried the video, but I know it is there should it become the best way to capture some action. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I got this camera for my wife to have an easy and compact camera. The camera is small, very fast and easy to use. The on camera help is very helpful. I found only minor issues when trying to trick the camera with hard to focus pictures with many different depth. The portrait mode is absolutely amazing. would love to see that in raw mode on my Sony A850. Video is also good. Beside the missing raw mode it is a great camera for that price and features.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Upgrading from HX1. I'm enjoying HX100. Great pic at high ISO. Quick focus! Great video quality. The HDR is awesome and could be used with flash! The LCD is a joke... very bad... much reds and contrast. The video button position is horrible. Where is the semi-manual focus?!?!? Use the ring to focus is awful...

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this 2 weeks ago for our trip to Chicago. It was very convenient to only have to carry 1 camera for both still pics and HD video. It's light weight and compact enough that my wife put it in her handbag. The picture quality is great. The zoom is very good. The HD video is excellent so far. The only thing is that you have to use the software that Sony provides with the camera to be able to view the recorded videos. There may be other media that you can use to view these instead but I'm not sure which one. There are many functions that we are still learning how to use. Also the recording speed is OK, not super fast, but then it may be due to the speed of our memory card, not so much of the camera.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: features and battery life
Cons: included software
I love this camera! I always wanted a camera that I could use for my photography hobby, but could never afford a DSLR. This is a great alternative. If you have any previous photography experience/knowledge it will be a breeze to use. I am still learning, so some features are still a little confusing. The LCD screen is not easy to see in bright sunlight, so you'll have to switch to the view finder. The battery life is great, and all the different settings/features are awesome. With a full charge, you can get around 220 minutes out of the battery (more or less depending function and use). So far, I've really only taken a few test shots so I could try a couple of the different settings. I love the "pet" scene setting. My do ... g won't sit still for anyone and not one of the pictures that I took of him were blurry. I also tried the "soft skin" scene setting, and that seemed to really work as well. If you can't take a great picture with this camera, you should just go back to disposable cameras. There were two things that I was slightly disappointed with. The first is that I wish it came with a hard copy manual instead of the CDROM version. It does come with a "quick start" manual; it's just lackng so many details that I would prefer to have at my fingertips instead of in my computer. The other disappointment was the sftware the camera comes with. It seems pretty limited in regards to functionality. I would like the software to have some basic editing features, which it doesn't seem to have. You can; however, crop and fix red eye right on the camera. I would suggest purchasing a separate editing program if you would like more advanced editing options. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I GOT THIS AS A CHRISTMAS PRESENT FOR MY FIANCE. I LOVED THE EASE OF USE ON THIS CAMERA AND VIDEOS WERE EXCELLENT. IT WORKED FINE UP UNTIL IT STARTED TO FREEZE DURING SOME BURST SHOTS. AFTER REMOVING THE BATTERY AND RESETTING IT A FEW TIMES, AS IT WOULD NOT RESPOND ANY OTHER WAY, IT EXHIBITED MORE UNSATISFACTORY QUIRKS. THE CAMERA WOULD NOT TURN OFF UNLESS THE BATTERY WAS REMOVED AND SEEMED TO LAG EXTENSIVELY DURING NORMAL SHOOTING MODES. I WILL BE RETURNING THIS CAMERA AND LOOKING FOR SOMETHING ELSE. I HAVE PRIMARILLY PURCHASED SONY PRODUCTS IN THE PAST AND HAVE HAD A FEW OF THEIR CAMERAS SERVE ME QUITE WELL, BUT I WILL LOOK ELSEWHERE ON THIS ONE...

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am pleased with the camera performance & the video looks better than I expected--really good. Loads of features, light in weight, easy to handle. I just wish it accepted filters. The max range of the lens is tough to handhold @ 800mm! The electronic viewfinder is better than most competitors & quite usable. Buy the optional battery charger for more convenience.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: BEST CAMERA YOU CAN BUY FOR THIS PRICE RANGE
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality and especially video quality
Cons: Time spent changing between video and still
I did a lot of research when I decided to upgrade from my 5 year old canon point and shoot. Considered everything from a new point and shoot up to a canon t2i and equivalents. My main goal was to get great still pics and HD video all in one camera. This camera has fulfilled that goal beyond expectations, especially considering it is under $500 and you don't have to carry around different lenses. Its amazing how the electronics make up for the small sensor size. There are lots of modes that you can quickly switch to (action, burst, low light, background defocus, etc#. I am especially impressed with the background defocus #looks professional# as well as the low light options - I ... rarely use the flash. Given all this I am most impressed with the HD video. The quality is nearly blu ray and the stock #no ext mic) sound quality is also excellent. Hands down, this Sony is best in class and I would argue unless you area professional you don't need the dslr class. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great camera for its price. Great 30 x optical zoom and a perfect 16.2 MP sensor. Camera works just nice on auto-mode and also on hand-mode but I'm still learning that part. This is THE camera to take with you on holidays. Clear photos and a Master zoom + excellent panorama-view. You don't have to carry the large lenses. Video captering also great. Top camera with lots of futures.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
There are lots of reviews on this product but as a consumer - this is what I consider matters: 1. Ease of use 2. Manual features 3. Large easy to view display 4. 1080p video in AVCHD@60fps & MP4@30fps format 5. Huge zoom
While using this camera - the only things I would like improvement is the shooting while recording a movie and continuous low fps shooting:
If MP4 is selected, then the max. resolution is about 3MP at the highest 1440/1080p @30fps. If using AVCHD - its not possible at the 60fps mode. Other competitors have the ability to take full resolution while recording HD video.
The next thing is the continuous shooting, at the 10 fps - it only does shots then takes 8 seconds while recording to card, that's amazing and sure beats many other came ... ras. HOWEVER: if 2 fps is selected - I would have expected continuous action until the card fills up - but tragically it stops at 10 shots. I tried dropping the resolution from 16MP-10MP-5MP but same thing.
Had I known this limitation - I may not have selected Sony. Other competitors can muster 1.4, 3 or 5 fps until the card tanks. Sony loses a whole point out of 5 for that. My old Canon SX10 could do 1.4 fps to card until it filled up.
Overall - the camera delivers the goods. If your requirements is continuous low fps shooting or shooting full resolution while recording video - look elsewhere because you will be disappointed. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great camera for the price. Loaded with features.
My little point and shoot Canon took a dump on me before my business trip to Sweden. Decided I needed to invest in a somewhat decent camera and ran across the Cybershot H100V. I can honestly say this is by far the best camera for a novice like myself. This thing is packed with features and it takes excellent pictures. I thought the size would be an issue, but so far I've been able to maneuver with it as if it were a small point and shoot. If your in the market for a good camera I highly recommend the H100V.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Low light and specialized photography modes. Long zoom and macro great for wild life.
Cons: DSLR still trumps image quality but comparison between subcompact and DSLR getting much closer.
While DSLR will take a better picture in some situations, you can't beat the flexibility of this camera for all situations. Be it video, stabilized long zooms, or portraits, this camera does it all reasonably well while carrying a minimum of equipment.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Bought this to replace a long zoom point and shoot that I have never been happy about. The Sony meets my expectations. In a perfect world it would have a dedicated hot shoe, filter mount threads, and facility for a lens hood, but we all know about perfect worlds! I am quite pleased with the pictures and movies this camera provides, Some reviewers have bemoaned the lack of a camera independant charger. They should know that the camera uses a Sony camcorder bettery, and travel chargers are available. I have one and it charges the battery more rapidly than the in camera charge. Dual chargers are also available. Check with Sony.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent pictures, color is great, EASY to use!
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, built in "how to" manual, excellent zoom, battery life
Cons: Price is a bit high
I've had a lot of digital cameras...right now I own 7. But this one, is truly all I need. The close-ups are unbelievable! I took a ton of pictures at the San Diego Zoo last weekend, and these are by far the best I have taken. Color is sharp, EASY to use.....and it's like being right next to the animal.
The viewfinder automatically pops on when you bring the camera up to your eye. When you bring it down, say to take pix from chest level, the LCD comes on...truly amazing!

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Definitely a BRIDGE - not tiny, not huge. Awesome zoom.
Cons: viewfinder could be better
This is actually my THIRD purchase of this camera. I have the H9, the HX1 and now the HX100V. They keep getting better each time. The Zeiss lens on the HX100V is very sharp overall, but it's the Best Macro I've ever had. The processing takes longer than the HX1, but it's doing more, so I get it, and plan for it. (Yes, I have a fast card.) Because of my poor eyesight, the viewfinder is basically useless (and very small), but I rarely would use it anyway. The viewing screen is SO sharp and clear; that was my big reason for upgrading. LOVE the tilting screen; I use the heck out of that! I also like the size and weight difference. I can't use tiny pocket cameras - I'm an old SLR user, a ... nd I have a DSLR Sony S550 that I also use. The movies are excellent, and while I didn't buy it for movies, it's fun to just grab a short one during an outing. Ease of Use is highest if you just slap it on one of the Auto settings, but it does SO much more. VERY good camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Large Clear LCD; Great Zoom; Good Image Quality
I recently used this camera on vacation to take over 500 photos. Most were outdoor action shots. I like the featurs of this camera, especially the "Burst" setting and also the panoramic setting. I also like the menu driven system that shows so much information about the camera operation and specific functions. I am not an expert, but this was an excellent upgrade to my previous "pocket" style digital cameras!

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: This camera is a Ton of Fun!
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Resolution; Good Battery Life; Amazing Video; Easy to Use; Good in Low Light; Lots of "Smart" features; Great Zoom; Large Clear LCD; Fast Shutter Speed
Cons: No way to force flash; No Raw Support
This camera rocks. Period. Fantastic zoom, great image stabilization. There are so many useful intelligent auto features, plus all kinds of manual control for the knowledgable shutter bug. It's super easy to use and take great photos, and the 1080/60P video is better than my dedicated HD Camcorder. If you are looking for a step up from the typical point and shoot, but dont want a full fledged SLR, you will not be disappointed with this camera.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: picture quality, video quality, zoom, manual focus, detachable screen
Cons: pricey (but worth it)
I bought this camera last week and already used it enough to know that this product is really great. I honestly wasn't expecting to spend so much money on a camera but really couldn't be any happier with it. The picture and video quality are awesome. I took it to a concert and was able to take some nice clear pictures and videos thanks to the 30x zoom! I also love the manual focus feature. Well actually, there's nothing that I don't love about this camera.... LOL. It's pretty pricey, I know, but it's way worth it!. I purchased the Nikon L120 before this one because of the price. I ended up having to return it because the picture quality was very poor... So I guess that if y ... ou want something good and reliable you gotta pay the price, right? expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: best super zoom for the money
Item.Review: This is absolutely the BEST superzoom point and shoot I have ever used. I shoot pro and when I cannot take the regular cameras and lenses, this almost full size (and that's a good thing) body does it all. The Zeiss lens is way above average and quite sharp, even at max 800 plus mm equivalent. The 1cm macro section is stunning. I shoot mostly existing light subjects still and action so the high ASA eq is not a feature I worry about. Camera noise is at a min for the ASA/ISO setting I use. The only downside to the camera is that it does not come with an external 110 and/or 12v batt charger and it does not have a threaded barrel to accept filters (I use a larger polarizer and rotate it manually with excellant results) or hoods...tho I understand that a slip on is in the works. For the pric ... e this camera can be considered one of the best! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: As a travel camera, it gets used constantly & tested over a wide range of photo types - from wide scenery, portait, macro & action movies. It captures all these modes accurately & the macro is particularly good. Twice the camera focus has frozen & requires the battery to be removed / reinstalled to rectify the fault.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: A bridge between point and shot to professional
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality
Cons: Can not find a underwater housing for it...
I was a proud owner of a Kodak V803, but I wanted some features that my Kodak did not offer. I purchased this camera because of:
1- The burst mode (allows you to take action shots. 10 FPS) 2- Sweep Panoramic (just move your camera from right to left and it creates your photo for you) 3- Defocus background (you can take a picture of an subject while defocusing the objects in the background)
It was between this camera and the NEX-5. I chose this camera because I do not think I will need more than 30X optical zoom. Having to buy additional lenses, makes a simple purchase become really expensive. If you buy this camera, along with any camera that shoots in HD, get a class 10 memory card. ... r> Only reason I did not give this camera a 5 Star rating is the software package, but other than taht I am really happy with my purchase. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Much Better Pics Than I Expected!
Item.Review: Owned this camera for only a week and am impressed with just the auto pics I have taken. The camera continues to impress me the more I explore the features. This is not a pocket camera. But its not as bulky as some. Really like the 30 power zoom. Great clarity and color. Buy this camera, you won't regret the purchase.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: speed, capabilities, features, video
Cons: charge battery by plugging camera in
I chose this camera for all-around shooting. I would love to get back into SLR semi-pro shooting but just can't justify the cost so have gone with these 'super zoom' class cameras for a while now. I mainly wanted speed (both in terms of shooting and light), lower noise (old camera was a Panisonic Lumix FZ20 - quite noisy), and HD video. Compared this Sony to the Canon PowerShot SX30 IS, Nikon Coolpix P500 and L120, and the Olympus SZ-30MR. All are quite capable and each has some unique strengths so suggest looking at all of them. Chose this Sony for the speed, exceptional video capabilities, awesome automatic HDR (High Dynamic Range) shooting, and overall feature balance. I'm still learning ... how best to use the different modes and settings but have taken some amazing shots in VERY difficult situations (including low light, high contrast light, extreme zoom, motion, etc.) and it has performed better than I hoped. One negative is that starting and stopping the video takes a little longer than seems appropriate (like 6 - 10 seconds +). Another negative is that it does not come with a separate charger - you must charge by plugging the camera in and the separate charger is rather expensive (but this keeps the camera cost down). expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Good for usually day, neither very good nor very bad. LCD screen isn't faithful colors, only one jpeg compression level, obligatory review of last shot, and no accessory. Great feature: optical lens is very good.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Extremely versatile & lightweight compared to an SLR. This has to be the best Advanced Point & Shoot on the market today. High quality optics and easy menu choices. Even a sweep panarama setting. How about 29 -870mm for a single zoom lens. 1080/60p HD video and photo capture from movie. You can't ask for much more from a point & shoot. I almost forgot...this camera even has an embeded GPS sytem. It is a WOW!

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: One of the best superzoom cameras!!
Item.Review: The new Sony HX100V, 30x camera is a real keeper among all the new super zoom cameras out there. It is comfortable to use, has a great tilting LCD, is fast, focuses spot on, and gives any user plenty of auto and manual options. It has a super high res I-panorama mode that is a lot of fun, and a smart auto mode for tricky conditions where you have to get the shot and don't have time for manual overrides. The image quality is best in good light but it's higher ISO quality is actually usable unlike previous smaller sensor super zoom cameras like this. The 30x zoom is simply incredible with a very usable digital zoom also. I finally have a camera I can get crisp full zoom shots with and this goes for the HD video mode also. The IS/OS is one of the best I have seen also. The video on this camer ... a has several HD settings and is really nice to view on an HDTV monitor. Video I have shot so far has been colorful and detailed and shows no artifacts typical of other P/S cams's video. You can be confident if this is the only camera you have when you venture out to shoot, your video will now rival stand alone HD video cameras. Sony is to be commended for the job they did with the image quality, speed, and video modes on this camera. Only gripes are lack of compression settings for images, and a larger buffer for high speed shooting so you could go like 20 seconds without having to wait for the buffer to clear. The latter is not a big issue as it only takes like 4-6 seconds to clear the buffer using a 30-45 MB per sec. type ultra high speed SD card. I am using a Sandisk extreme pro 16 GB 45 MB/sec and it is really fast writing images from this camera. Other than that I am so glad Sony came out with this camera this spring instead of fall as I now have the whole summer to use it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: A photo fun camera for all
Item.Review: I rate this camera 5* because it is that much better than the rest of the point and shoots. My main camera is the Sony Alpha 850 a pro camera and superb shooter but it is limited in what it does. The Sony DSC-HX100V however is a do it all camera and I give the photos it takes an overall quality score of 94/100. My Alpha 850 would be a 99/100. Lots of available setting choices to have fun with and I mean fun! You will enjoy this camera a lot. You can allow the camera to do it all for you by just selecting the scene or mode/mood setting and the end results will be very pleasing. More adventurous photo hogs can of course use the 'A' 'S' 'P' and 'M' modes and do it all like a pro. But if I wanted to do that all of the time I would not of bought this camera, this is the latest tech in t ... he one camera does it all fun shooting field, this is the ultimate fun/vacation camera and hey! it even looks like a camera and not a cig box. I hate those skinny little things. This camera has a small learning curve even with so many different things it can do, it comes with instructions and explanations of all modes built right into the camera for ease of learning. At 30x zoom the camera must be supported like on a tripod, but the range is an amazing 800mm but the pictures will not be as sharp as shooting at closer range but still good to view. Because of the image complexity like the camera taking several shots at once and combining them in camera for better quality the time lag is about 5/6 seconds for getting the next shot. But on settings without this feature the time lag is zero although the overall shooting speed is not as fast as a DSLR. My parting words would be for anyone starting out as a photo hog this is a great camera to start with. And to the pro shooter, leave all the other stuff in the studio/photo bag and go have some fun. The photos are very good, showing sharp detail and color reproduction extremely well and of course full HD videos. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I just purchase the camera and all the futures in this item are amazing. Another great product by Sony. Previous to this was a Nikon coolpix 100, I paid last summer almost 300 dollars and for 99.00 more y have a double quality and better product. No more blurie pictures with the zoom. Once you focus the zoom stay there and pics are more than perfect. The multiple angle or sweep across pictures work great you just move like you wast taken a video and the cam do it all. Take those pics like in a 180 degree single shoot. Thank Sony, because for a 399.00 you let me have a camera that work like a pro. No more waste of money in duracell batteries. Live you guys.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The clarity of the photos taken from this camera are beautiful! The images are sharp and the colors are vibrant. If you are looking for a camera that could produce DSLR like images, this camera is highly recommended! It is easy to use and the weight is not too heavy. I've always loved SONY products and this one is a keeper for many years ahead.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Large Clear LCD; Good Image Quality; Good Image Stabilization; Nice Body Color; Short Lag Time; Great Zoom; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Easy To Use
The camera is great, feels good, looks good and performs very good. Much better pictures than compact point and clicks but much more user friendly than DSLR's. We love the rechargeable battery and large, pivoting LCD screen.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Ease of use, easy for beginners and more experienced, wonderful zoom
Cons: can not change lenses
I was really worried about getting the right SLR camera, since it was my 1st. I took it on vacation to Utah and love the motion stability feature. This feature is wonderful when taking pictures of active toddlers. While driving through the mountains I was able to put it on the easy setting and my son who has very little camera experience actually was able to take some wonderful pictures. I would recommend this camera to 1st time SLR Camera buyers and for amateurs who love to take pictures. The zoom lens picks out things you can not see with the naked eye. I took a picture of ship on the horizon and when I downloaded the picture into my computer you could see birds on the shi ... p and the name of the ship. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera if you take your time to learn it.
Item.Review:
Pros: It will take great pictures for you.
Cons: Want fit into my pocket anymore.
I have found this camera to be one of the best I have ever had. It will take time to lean just how good it can be and you'll be amazed as how good it will be. Don't think you'll be able to do all the things this camera will do in a couple days. Unless you're a pro at camers which I not. Take your time and shoot many shots at the same subject while changing the setting to see the different ways to get nothing but the best picture. Both inside and outside pictures. Give it a chance and you will be very satified with your new camera. Its not one you just point and shoot. But one you can improve with ever shoot you take. Had it for 16 days and still learning how good it is for me.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: feel and build quality
Cons: little pricey
Great size, features and weight. Takes great photos. Bought 2 Sony cameras the same day ... one for the pocket and this sweeeet SLR. Both are fantastic! You can take this from someone who worked at Kodak for over 32 years and owned lots of Kodak film and digital cameras..... never again!

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: Nothing
I absolutely love this camera. I also love my Panasonic ZS3 but wanted more zoom and more manual controls. I had no desire for a DSLR with lots of lenses to carry around. This camera's zoom is even better than I expected. The picture quality is amazing, even in digital zoom. It's easy to use, feels great in my hand, has incredible battery life, and takes great quality photos. You can't go wrong with this camera.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: If you are ready to graduate from the world of point and shoot to a camera that's loaded with features and functionality, takes great pictures and has an awesome zoom, but don't want the expense of DSLR's or the bother of changing lenses and lugging a lot of heavy equipment around, I would highly recommend this Cyber-shot. I debated for a long time between this and the Canon SX30IS. In all the expert and user reviews I read, the Sony came out a little ahead for performance and design, and more or less even on picture quality. It's slightly smaller and lighter than the SX30IS, is faster, has a zoom lens that can be adjusted both manually and automatically, and generally costs about $100 more, but catch it on sale at best buy to cut that difference in half. I use this on long walks to take p ... ictures of wildlife, after graduating from my trusty Canon digital elph. I wanted a megazoom to be able to capture subjects that are typically very far away. I've taken it out twice now and find it performs equally well whether taking macro shots or using the megazoom. The video clips are extremely sharp - the only issue I haven't figured out is in downloading my photos for a day, only still images are transferred to my PC while I have to go in and manually downlaod the videos. A minor compliaint and I am sure there is a solution to it. Cool features are a sensor that can tell when you are brining the camera up to your eyes or holding it away from your eyes -it automatically switches between viewfinder and LCD. The LCD is large and clear. The battery life seems very good. While it has a dizzing array of features, at a touch of a button or twist of a dial, you can shoot movies, take panoramic shots, switch between two different burst options and normal shooting modes, adjust settings manually or let the camera do all the work on one of two intelligent auto modes, or select the type of scene you want from the in camera guide, which also lets you look up issues to troubleshoot. I am n ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I got this camera only a couple of weeks ago, but can say that so far I am very pleased with the results. It produces very high quality pictures and is very easy to use. I am especially impressed with the quality of indoor pictures and in low light situations. Zoom is very easy to use and the zoom ring on the lense makes it easier to control. Burst mode is working perfectly with great results for all pictures taken at each burst.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The zoom on this camera is stunning! No changing lenses for X30 zoom. The stabilization makes for really sharp pictures with out a tripod. I took a photo of a fallen tree almost 300m (325yds) away on full zoom without a tripod. When I looked at the photos on the computer I saw that I had captured not only the fine sticks but also the spider webs in the tree branches! Only problems would be that it does not fit a lens filter and that the battery charges in the camera but a separate charger is available.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Best Shot selector, Panorama, 10 frames/sec, zoom
Cons: The ability to manually tweak some advanced settings.
I have a Nikon DSLR but bought this camera as an all purpose camera for a vacation in Turkey. Took me less 30 minutes of reading through the html manual to get a handle on the features - fairly easy. Awesome Feature # 1: The best shot selector - the camera takes a series of shots and selects the best - no blur or shake. Awesome Feature # 2: The intelligent panorama - just press and twist 180 degrees and you have a 180 panorama. Awesome Feature # 4: The really long zoom - while this is the smallest among the superzoom Canon and Nikon, it is enough. Plus I feel that its anti shake and low light performance is tops. Great picture quality, if keep an eye on the W ... B. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Good pictures, Great zoom!!, Excellent HD video!!
Item.Review:
Pros: Zoom!! , HD video , Features
Cons: No continuos shooting. Auto mode for action shots
The picture quality is great as long as you have the settings correct or if in auto mode the camera chooses the right settings. I took about 1,100 pics so far and the camera does'nt do so well in auto mode for fast action shots or too much movement at all, Pictures come out blurry! I suggest using burst mode or set the camera's settings to action for the best results. The zoom is fantastic!! I like being able to get in close without changing the lens. The auto focus works pretty well at high zoom but i noticed that if you are to close to something it will not focus. The video on this camera is also fantastic!! No complaints on that. Overall this is a great camera for someone not wanting ... to pay for a dslr. I wish it had continuos shooting and that auto mode worked a little better. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: long zoom, picture quality, price
Cons: nothing so far.
I got this camera primarily for concerts. The zoom gets you right in the action without the SLR price(many venues won't allow cameras with changeable lenses). Picture quality is excellent( especially the HD), features easy to use. I own another Sony camera, and I love it as well. I recommend it to anyone!

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: A Fun camera that takes fantastic photos
Item.Review: I wanted a camera that takes high quality photos with a good zoom for travel and work. For work I wanted a camera with GPS to locate where photos were taken. I didn't want the hassle of changing lenses on a DSLR (been there done that) and wanted to start exploring high definition movies. After reading many reviews and recommendation from friends who own the Sony NEX5 I decided to purchase the HX100V and glad I did! The image stabilization is amazing even at 30x zoom. The camera performs well from close up t long zoom and the Intelligent Auto is flawless. Sweep zoom is very impressive and fun. Low light photography is also impressive - this is a great all around camera and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a versatile camera with GPS and long zoom.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am a beginner, at best. However, this camera is a perfect fit. I am very pleased with the quality of focus. I checked out professional reviews and new that this would be a great camera. I actually saw a professional photographer at a dinner part last night using it. I started taking pictures of my kid racing around the kitchen island. The lens was set on automatic. I had exactly 2/10 throw-aways due to slow action. I am sure that I can change the settings to ramp that up. There are a lot of features I have not used. I look forward to using the fine manual focus switch on the side of the lens for macro quality close ups. Sony is tops. I replaced my Canon 530, which stopped working when I dropped it. I am glad I changed brands. The Canon never took focused shots. Also, low l ... ight shots was a joke. I bought this Sony b/c it had great low light reviews, and it is true. Buy it, enjoy it-if you need a point and shoot, it is rated high in my mind. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Used for Family Photos and Video. Both the Photo and Video quality are impresive with high resolution. The sound capture on video is excellent. For me it is an all in one solution for still and video capture on family outings and vacations. Switching from photo to video is an easy one touch button. Zoom is great although at the highest zoom you will have to steady yourself to avoid blur. I carried this camera around all day long without strain. There is a learning curve. however, once you are familair with this camera it becomes very easy to operate with a variety of settings to allow you to get the best still shots. Burst mode also works perfectly. Overall I would highly recommend this camera. It it is certainly the best point and shoot camera I have every owned.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I replaced my former DSLR with multiple lens and chose the HX-100 and would never go back. I travel with my camera and take a lot of nature shots and this camera is super. It does everything for the non professional and still allows a more advanced user to control the shot. To this date I have found nothing wrong with this camera but I do wish there was an external charging system for the battery. Fantastic camera. I would recommend this camera to everyone.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Best camera on the market today
Item.Review:
Pros: Clarity, 1080p video, style, technology, value
Cons: nothing really
I was undecided between the Nikon and the Sony but eventually went with the Sony because of the 1080P video and good reviews. I'm glad I did!! This is by far the best camera I've owned. I was able to take some amazing pictures at a concert I went to. The clarity of the zoom was amazing. The 1080p video looked as if you were there, and the was only matched by the crystal clear undistorted sound. Although I'm still a student of the camera trying to learn it's bells and whistles, you can still take some awesome pictures without being an expert. I also like that it tells you how much battery life you have (by the minute) so you don't get caught off guard. You can also shoot video in 3-D which I think will b ... e cool to tryl!! I do recoommend buying accessories online as I did. You can usually find the exact model for half the price. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I use this camera for everything: wildlife, scenic, portraits, birds, whatever comes up. It is extremely versatile and gives top performance for everything, without having to carry lots of extra equipment. It is extremely user friendly and gives excellent quality. I took stunning portraits, captured some lovely owls at night while I held it by hand only. It is fast and with the 16 megapixels provide lovely, clear shots. I can spend time on playing with the different settings, or select a quick mode and capture fast moving objects. All the controls are placed very conveniently and it provides an excellent zoom. There is absolutely nothing that I do not like about this camera. As a matter of fact, I like it so much that I ordered one for my daughter as well. This camera is great value for mo ... ney and makes photography absolutely enjoyable. One can be so creative. It is awful for those spur of the moment pictures or adventures and light enough to carry even on a long hike. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great on features, mediocre on IQ.
Item.Review: I chose this camera over a DSLR. Mostly because I needed a quick camera which also has good video-recording, with a good performance. Sony HX100V delivers it with 10fps continuous shooting, quick start-up and AF. I love the videos that the camera produces. In low light you will need to use the flash with this camera, and it will work great then. Sony put 16Mpx into the small sensor which affected sensitivity. Plus the processor inside the camera compresses the pictures too much IMHO.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
I just got back from a two-week trip in Europe with my new Sony DSC-HX100V Camera and wanted to add my feedback to help others and thank everyone who helped me choose this camera. In summary, this is a fantastic camera and was a pleasure to use. It is a large step up from my older version from Sony. I took more than 4,000 photographs in two weeks. and put the camera through about every test that it could have.
In more detail, here are the key aspects and my two cents on them.
Overall Camera Performance: This camera is a work horse and had many features that made it a dream to work with and a couple that are major issues in my opinion (which I will cover later). I used the Superior Auto automatic feature almost exclusively with the hand dial located near the shutter release I ... quickly tweaked the EV levels when necessary. It also does this for you automatically by taking three bracketed photographs. I chose to have the instant control which worked very well for me. The battery life was very good. I had three batteries which lasted longer than I anticipated. I would charge them daily which more than met my needs. Only once did I run out of batteries and used my new Sony DSC-H70 at that time. I actually switched between cameras depending if I needed a really wide angle or wanted to be less obvious.
Picture Quality: Picture quality was outstanding even at the longer focus distances. What an incredible range of framing options with the 30x Zoom. In many cases, since I was shooting at the highest 16M size I simply made minor edits in the camera after the shot. I was totally amazed at the picture quality at all ranges day and night. Even though I took a monopod, I never used it. All photographs were either hand held or I found a natural tripod at night to add some minor stability. I was more than impressed with the picture quality and so were the people I was traveling with.
Ease of Use: This is a very easy camera to use. Most things are well placed and there are great ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: weight, 30x zoom, pictures
Cons: zoom hard to change in small imcrements
Step up from the pocket point and shoot. Greater capacity without the weight of a DSLR. Easy to shoot with one hand, well weighted. Any one who tries it is impressed.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera using it for kids sports awesome pics
Item.Review:
Pros: Action sports burst mode/color quality
Cons: would like larger zoom
I bought this to take pics of my kids lacrosse and soccer. It does a great job of taking multiple action shots. I can get the kids firing shots right through until it hits the next. Sony makes it easy to use with a great lens leading to great pictures. My 12 yr old has been taking pics with it and it took him about 5 minutes to figure it out. Would defintitely recommend it

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: All of the above.
Cons: Haven't found it yet.
Sony quality. Features that will keep you up at night playing with the camera. Auto focus that rarely misses. Burst mode and video that are as good as it gets. For the functionally challenged fellow who couldn't print the owner's manual, just download from the web. It was easy to find. This is a great camera. I would give it six stars if I could.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Burst shot, clear pictures
Cons: Learning curve
I purchased my camera a few weeks ago and I've been using it a lot since then and I am very impressed with it. While it is not a camera that you'll quickly learn how to use (like any high end camera) the on screen displays and CD-manual will make learning the features go by a lot faster. Expect to spend a few weeks playing with the settings to learn what works the best with what.
My primary concern was burst shot since I used that with my prior camera. When the specs said 10 shots per second I figured that was with the lowest settings. I am glad I was wrong - 10 shots per second with full resolution. When reviewing you need to "expand" the first picture to view the entire set.
Moving panoramic - you just rota ... te the camera where you want a panoramic picture (and these pictures are true panoramic - not cropped normal pictures like the "Panoramic / regular cameras").
So far I am very impressed with this camera, it seems to be one step below a DSLR camera without the high price. My only recommendation is to make sure you have a high end memory card, like a class 10 SD card for fast recording and high capacity (16 or 32GM) to store the pictures (and easy card / camera to PC transfers). expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Zoom, Quality, Features, Battery Life
Cons: Manual
Waited months for this camera to arrive. I tried the Sony NEX-3 and while it was very nice I didn't like having to interchange the lenses. I cannot tell a difference in picture quality from the NEX-3 and of course now I have 30x zoom!!! Definitely takes some time to figure out the settings if not an experienced DSLR user, but even the auto mode works very well. This is the first time that I get excited about taking pictures. Very, very happy with this camera.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX100V 16.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Design , All features, like 3D, defocus mode, i auto mode etc, easy to use, 30x zoom, tilt screen, smile shutter
Cons: picture quality, (its good, not excellent)it makes sense, otherwise who would buy those expensive SLRs
After order, I got this camera 5 days late than schedule store pick up ( was not available anywhere, neither online nor in stores, or at Sony), so I missed most important moments of my life(my graduation and trip to chicago) to capture, At first after I open box, it is distinct than any other digital camera (design is really good) Now I am testing this camera near by lake and landscape, in door low light, 3D, fast moving objects like cars etc. It has so many cool features that will amaze you. I captured pic of car going at min 40mph without movin ... g camera from approx 250 feet at 10pics/sec burst, surprisingly I could read license plate of that car in pic. picture quality is not too different/superior than other digital cameras (over $250 range), but features are great picture at 30x zoom is really steady. I thought I'll miss high speed video but HD 1080 recording is really good(60fps), good quality when played at slow speed (1/4). This camera can take pics in really low light without using flash. Only thing disappointing is picture quality is not good as per 16MP at optimum level of light (because always expects high quality from Sony).
Reason behind buying HX100v is, I needed video camera with HD video, high zoom and camera that can capture less blurry high resolution pics at low light. Overall it does good job.
